function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Contradictory definitions of resilience may lead to confusion and inefficiency in implementation of resilience measures.","Impact":"Misallocation of resources, lack of clear guidance, and inadequate preparedness for critical infrastructure","Mitigation":"Harmonization of definitions through international agreements and guidelines, clear communication of terminology, and education and training on resilience concepts.","Technologies":"Standardized terminology and definitions, communication tools, and education platforms","People":"Policy makers, infrastructure managers, and emergency responders","Owner":"International organizations, government agencies, and educational institutions"},{"Description":"Lack of full incorporation of resilience-based approach into EU and national frameworks may result in inadequate protection of critical infrastructure.","Impact":"Vulnerability of critical infrastructure to disruption, limited resilience capacity, and inability to prevent and recover from incidents","Mitigation":"Alignment of EU and national frameworks with resilience-based principles, incorporation of prevention measures, and development of resilience-building policies","Technologies":"Policy development tools, regulatory frameworks, and resilience assessment methodologies","People":"Government agencies, critical infrastructure operators, and resilience experts","Owner":"European Commission, national governments, and resilience organizations"},{"Description":"Contradictory understanding of resilience may hinder the achievement of disaster risk reduction and climate change adaptation objectives.","Impact":"Increased susceptibility to disasters, limited adaptation to climate change, and failure to reduce disaster risk","Mitigation":"Integration of resilience with disaster risk reduction and climate change adaptation strategies, cross-sector collaboration, and holistic risk management approaches","Technologies":"Integrated risk assessment tools, climate modeling and prediction systems, and cross-sector communication platforms","People":"Disaster management agencies, climate change specialists, and cross-sector collaboration teams","Owner":"International organizations, disaster risk management agencies, and climate change organizations"}]}
